info.title: HPE OneSphere API
info.description:
HPE OneSphere hybrid cloud management REST API.

For calls requiring authentication use /rest/session to get a token.

get.description: Get supported versions
Returns the global account information. **Not implemented**

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

get.description: Returns appliances.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
The name of the desired appliance.
This parameter may be repeated with multiple appliance names.

parameters.name: regionUri
parameters.description: Set of appliances in this region.

post.description: Create an appliance.

delete.description:
Delete an appliance.
This removes the appliance registration and tears down the secure
comms link to the on-premise appliance.
If zones exist on this appliance, an '409' error will be returned.
The zones on this appliance must be removed before the appliance
delete request can be accepted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

get.description: Returns an appliance based on its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: List of appliance updates.

get.description: Returns billing accounts. It requires the **administrator** or **project creator** global role.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Filters the billing accounts returned.

It supports equality
comparison against one or more properties using a
``"name EQ value"`` syntax. Multiple comparisons can be combined
using a ``"name1 EQ value1 AND name2 EQ value2"`` syntax.

It supports comparison of **providerTypeUri** and **name**.

For example: ``query="providerTypeUri EQ /rest/provider-types/azure"``

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

post.description: Creates a new billing account. It requires the **administrator** role.

parameters.name: billing
parameters.description: Add new billing account

delete.description: Deletes a billing account. It requires the **administrator** role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

get.description: Returns a billing account based on its id. It requires the **administrator** or **project creator** global role. Credentials are not included.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

patch.description: Updates a billing account. It requires the **administrator** role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: List of appliance updates.

get.description: Returns catalog types.
Returns catalogs. It requires the **consumer** global role.

parameters.name: userQuery
parameters.description:
Filters the catalogs returned.

It performs a case insensitive comparison of the supplied string
value with the **name** property.

For example: ``userQuery="dock"``

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

post.description: Creates a new catalog.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Add new catalog

delete.description: Delete a catalog and associated resources. **Not implemented**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

get.description: Returns a catalog based on its id. It requires the **consumer** global role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

patch.description: Patches a catalog. Allowed fields for PATCH of catalogs are name(add,replace), password(add), accessKey(add), secretKey(add), state(add,replace)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Add new catalog

get.description: Generates connect app s3 url

parameters.name: os
parameters.description: OS type for which compatible connect app URL has to be generated.

get.description: Returns deployments. It requires any project role or non-'consumer' global role.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Filters the billing accounts returned.

It supports equality
comparison against one or more properties using a
``"name EQ value"`` syntax. Multiple comparisons can be combined
using a ``"name1 EQ value1 AND name2 EQ value2"`` syntax.

It supports comparison of **providerTypeUri** and **name**.

For example: ``query="providerTypeUri EQ /rest/provider-types/azure"``

parameters.name: userQuery
parameters.description:
Filters the catalogs returned.

It performs a case insensitive comparison of the supplied string
value with the **name** property.

For example: ``userQuery="dock"``

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

post.description: Creates a new deployment. It requires any project role, or the **administrator** or **project creator** global role.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description: Add new deployment. If regionUri is specified and zoneUri is not specified, the zone that is configured as default will be used. If default zone is not configured then the first valid zone will be used to create the deployment.

delete.description: Delete a deployment and associated resources. It requires any project role, or the **administrator** or **project creator** global role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

get.description: Returns a deployment based on its id. It requires any project role or non-'consumer' global role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

patch.description: Updates a deployment. **Requires any project role, or 'administrator' or 'project creator' global role**. Allowed fields for PATCH of deployments are name(add,replace), volumes(add), k8snumWorkers(add), userData(add), serviceInput(add), version(add).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description: Add new deployment. If regionUri is specified and zoneUri is not specified, the zone that is configured as default will be used. If default zone is not configured then the first valid zone will be used to create the deployment.

post.description: Peforms an action to change the state of a deployment. It requires any project role, or the **administrator** or **project creator** global role.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to perform

post.description: Returns a deployment console URL for deployment

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

get.description: Returns the kubeconfig. Applicable only to deployments of Kubernetes cluster. **Requires 'consumer' role on workspace**

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

get.description: Returns events based on the supplied criteria. **Not implemented**

parameters.name: resourceUri
parameters.description: Resource to prune events by.

get.description: Get keypairs (per region, per user). Currently a projectUri is required

parameters.name: regionUri
parameters.description: Set of appliances in this region.

get.description: Returns membership (project-specific) roles.

delete.description: Delete a membership. It requires the **administrator** or **project creator** global role or the **project owner** role on the project.

parameters.name: membership
parameters.description: Delete membership

get.description:
Returns memberships. Supports filtering by projectUri, userUri, userGroupUri, roleUri (but only
individual values, not multiple) in 'query'.

If projectURI and userUri/userGroupUri are given a different
backend path will be used that should be authorized to a project owner even if they wouldn't ordinarily
be able to see other users' roles.

It requires the **administrator** or **project creator** global role or the **project owner** role on the project.
**project owner** requires **projectUri**

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Filters the billing accounts returned.

It supports equality
comparison against one or more properties using a
``"name EQ value"`` syntax. Multiple comparisons can be combined
using a ``"name1 EQ value1 AND name2 EQ value2"`` syntax.

It supports comparison of **providerTypeUri** and **name**.

For example: ``query="providerTypeUri EQ /rest/provider-types/azure"``

post.description: Creates a new membership. It requires the **administrator** or **project creator** global role or **project owner** role on the project.

parameters.name: membership
parameters.description: Delete membership

get.description:
Returns all metrics based on the supplied criteria. It requires the **analyst** role.
It requires one and only one of resourceUri or category to be specified.

parameters.name: resourceUri
parameters.description: Resource to prune events by.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
A category name. Include resources that are in this category. This can be combined with the query property to filter resources. It is invalid to specify this property if a resourceUri property is provided.
</br> **category examples:**
</br> *Get the cost.usage for all providers:*
GET /rest/metrics?"**category=providers&name=cost.usage**&periodStart=2017-12-01T00:00:00Z&period=month&periodCount=-1&view=full"
</br> *Get the cost.usage for all projects:*
GET /rest/metrics?"**category=projects&name=

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description:
A value to group the data by. It is invalid to specify this property if a resourceUri property is provided.
</br> **groupBy examples:**
</br> *Get the cost.total for all providers grouped by provider type:*
GET /rest/metrics?"**category=providers&name=cost.total&groupBy=providerTypeUri**&periodStart=2017-12-01T00:00:00Z&period=month&periodCount=-2&view=full"
</br> *Get the cost.usage for all providers grouped by provider type:*
GET /rest/metrics?"**category=providers&name=cost.usage&groupBy=prov

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Filters the billing accounts returned.

It supports equality
comparison against one or more properties using a
``"name EQ value"`` syntax. Multiple comparisons can be combined
using a ``"name1 EQ value1 AND name2 EQ value2"`` syntax.

It supports comparison of **providerTypeUri** and **name**.

For example: ``query="providerTypeUri EQ /rest/provider-types/azure"``

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
The name of the desired appliance.
This parameter may be repeated with multiple appliance names.

parameters.name: periodStart
parameters.description:
When the metric value(s) should be measured from. This must be aligned to the period requested. For instance, if the period is 'hour', this value must be at the top of an hour.
If not specified, it will default to the latest time for which the data is expected to be valid, aligned to the period boundary. For costs, this will be the start of the current UTC period. For scores (and score drill down metrics), this will be the previous hour, unless the current UTC time is less than 5 minutes into th

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
How much time to cover per data point. Certain metric names may support only a subset of these options. Scores support a period of 'day' or 'hour'. Costs only support a period of 'month'. Resources support a period of 'day' or 'hour'. 422 or 400 is returned if the metric name is not supported.
**example:** hour

parameters.name: periodCount
parameters.description:
How many period data points to return relative to the periodStart time. This value can be positive or negative.  Zero is invalid.
**default:** 1

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: Whether to return related content.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Index into the response members to allow pagination. Use in conjunction with the 'count' parameter to paginate through many metrics. **Not Implemented**

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of response members to return. Use in conjunction with the 'start' parameter to paginate through many metrics. **Not Implemented**

get.description: Returns a properties object needed to build the Azure login url
Returns the provider information required to add an Azure provider

parameters.name: directoryUri
parameters.description:
The Azure Directory URI associated with the Subscription
For Example:
myActiveDirectory.onmicrosoft.com

parameters.name: location
parameters.description:
The full response Azure sends to the redirectURI including valid Azure authentication code
For Example:
https://customername.hpeonesphere.net/rest/azureauth/?code=1234ABCD&state=5678&session_state=90EF

get.description: Returns a list of Azure subscriptions and their display names

get.description:
Returns rates. It requires the **administrator** global role.

Optionally this list may be filtered, or the default rates specified with a resourceUri of 'default'.

parameters.name: resourceUri
parameters.description: Resource to prune events by.

parameters.name: effectiveForDate
parameters.description: The date for which returned rates need be effective, a special filter that allows a search for a rate that would be effective on a date.  That is, to allow a search for a rate whose effective date is on or before the specified effectiveForDate.

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: The specific effective date to filter by.

parameters.name: metricName
parameters.description: The metric name to filter by.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Filter for active or inactive rates.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Index into the response members to allow pagination. Use in conjunction with the 'count' parameter to paginate through many metrics. **Not Implemented**

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of response members to return. Use in conjunction with the 'start' parameter to paginate through many metrics. **Not Implemented**

post.description: Create/Register a server.

delete.description:
Delete a server.
Note that by default only servers created via the HPE OneSphere API can be
subsequently deleted. HPE OneSphere managed servers (those that have
an applianceUri) cannot be deleted via this operation (a '403' will be returned),
unless the 'force' parameter is supplied and set to 'true'.

parameters.description: ID of the appliance to delete.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Region may be in an odd state. Force will attempt to delete again no matter the state.
